page.title: 17The Resevoir.
page.content: On the{2nd September 1940,}a member of {Braunton Parish Council}wrote to {Barnstaple Rural Council,}telling them that they had had many complaints about the shortage of water in Braunton. With the evacuees from the cities,a result of the{2nd world war, there was not enough water for people to use.The old resevoir could not cope with this influx. So a new resevoir had to be built. This was done after the war ended. Today, the resevoir is {the only source of water}in the village. Although Braunton gets{heavy {rainfall in winter,}the fact that it is the main source of water, means that there is always{a water}shortage in summer. This leads to{restrictions {such as a ban on the}use of hosepipes, and in extreme cases standpipes on the streets after water to homes has been entirely cut off.
